short_summary: Pilatus PC12 Series Maintenance and Parts
description: Pilatus PC12 Series airworthiness maintenance, testing, and inspection services and corresponding parts supply for 16 PC12 aircraft in current service by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. Services includes maintenance, repair, overhaul and modification of aircraft systems and components as well as supply of OEM parts, such as hydraulic and electrical components. The contract will initially run for four years with an option to extend for two years at the end of the first contract.
full_summary:
### Pilatus PC12 Series Maintenance and Parts Tender Announcement

**Reference Number:** PW-CAG-003-29108, Solicitation Number: M7594-232124/A
**Publication Date:** June 29, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** August 8, 2023, 14:00:00 hrs

**Background:**
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) requires maintenance and repair services for its fleet of 16 Pilatus PC12 Series aircraft. The Air Services Branch (ASB) of the RCMP seeks the services of a contractor to complement its internal maintenance capacity and facilitate the timely return to service of its aircraft.

**Objectives:**
- Provision of maintenance, repair, overhaul, and modification services for the RCMP's PC12 aircraft fleet.
- Supply of new and exchange/refurbish Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) parts for scheduled and unscheduled maintenance.

**Contract Requirements:**
- The contract will have a term of 4 years from the contract award date.
- The contractor grants Canada an option to extend the term by up to 1 additional 2-year period under the same conditions.

**Trade Agreements:**
- The requirement is subject to the provisions of the following trade agreements:
  * World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP)
  * North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)
  * Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
  * Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Eligibility:**
- Bidders must refer to Part 2 entitled Bidder Instructions and Part 3 entitled Bid Preparation Instructions of the bid solicitation for further information.
- The selection will be based on the Lowest Price Per Point.

**Submission Guidelines:**
- Interested suppliers can submit a bid.
- Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
- Late submissions will not be accepted.

**Contact Information:**
- Jeffrey Pakeman, tel: (343) 572-5074, e-mail: jeffrey.pakeman@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
